definition: circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)

sentences.english: Alckmin congratulated Hu Jintao upon the great success of his visit.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾克明祝賀胡錦濤此行取得圓滿成功。

sentences.english: The performance was rounded off with group-singing.
sentences.chinese: 演出在合唱聲中圓滿結束。

sentences.english: The cosmos has solemn order and orbicular harmony.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙具有嚴整的秩序，圓滿的和諧。

sentences.english: The long day and night was over, satisfactorily, we thought.
sentences.chinese: 我們以爲，漫長的一天一夜圓滿結束了。

sentences.english: The wedding ceremony was very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 結婚儀式進行得很圓滿。

sentences.english: eg: I sincerely wish this Business Summit a complete success.
sentences.chinese: 我衷心祝願本屆峯會取得圓滿成功。

sentences.english: C. T. Lee, Learn English series has finally drawn to a close.
sentences.chinese: 我們的《讀李家同學英文》系列終於圓滿結束了。

sentences.english: The Olympic Game in Beijing 2008 will goes off without a hitch.
sentences.chinese: 2008年的北京奧運會一定會辦得很成功圓滿。

sentences.english: They rounded off their performance with a mixed chorus.
sentences.chinese: 他們以一曲混聲合唱圓滿結束了他們的演出。

sentences.english: Supreme fruition is without hope and fear.
sentences.chinese: 最圓滿的果報是無希求和恐懼。

sentences.english: Lastly, meeting amid the sound of joy to a successful conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 最後，匯操在一片歡樂聲中圓滿結束。

sentences.english: Hereby, I'd like to wish this Sino-EU Economic Forum a complete success.
sentences.chinese: 在此，我預祝中歐經濟論壇取得圓滿成功。

sentences.english: He pulled off a million-pound deal beautifully.
sentences.chinese: 他圓滿地做成了一筆百萬英鎊的生意。

sentences.english: I will write the Gatha you requested.
sentences.chinese: 我將寫您所提請的普賢大圓滿偈。

sentences.english: Thanks to the special effort by badman hero_jang and hing most of the games were completed successfully.
sentences.chinese: 由於網管的努力，比賽的大部分對局都圓滿地完成了。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
